If you want just a taste of it I recommend going for lunch. However, for dinner it was pretty good. Everything was a la carte of course and the mac and cheese was very good. They were also really accommodating of my sister who eats gluten free.   I think it is too pricey for dinner and I was not totally blown away. I am eager to get back and try their lunch menu.

We have eaten as Zinc several times with a consistent amazing experience.  We enjoyed oysters, crepes, flat iron steak and frittes in our last visit.  All were well prepared and very tasty.  We closed out our meal with the choc souffle and were pleasantlysurprised by the best bottle of red wine I have had in years.   Sean the bartender took care of us.  A great experience and one of my favorite stops for thies foodee.

had a fantastic/delicious experience at zinc. i went with a friend for lunch, we were seated promptly and our charming and downright adorable server, aubrey, was helpful and wonderful. she made great wine pairing suggestions and made the experience delightful.  as a non-meat eater, i had to be choosy, but the kitchen seemed accommodating and everything was divine. down to the last bite of two mouth-watering desserts.

OMG my friends ... Zinc Bistro was dynamic from beginning to end !  Service and management were spot on ! We started with cocktails and Pork belly appetizer followed by a cup of onion soup and house salad .  Our featured entrees ...Ricotta Gnocchi ,and hubby had  Beef Cheeks . Each dish was a plethora of popping, bursting flavor ! Dessert? Absolutely, we had Chocolate Scuffle! It was everything and more  expect to spend around $150 .00 for two . as always if you go let me know . Enjoy

Zinc Bistro is an interesting French brasserie style restaurant. They clearly went out of their way to give it a French feel with the interior decor. We had reservations, and were seated at a nice table in the back near the kitchen. We had a team of two servers (apparently they were training a new one), which was fine. Both very sociable.   I ordered lamb shanks, and my mum ordered the scallops. To start we had the Zinc House Salad, which we asked to be split, and they did into two places (plus points for this). We ordered wine with dinner (I had a Bordeaux and mum had Vouvray), both our selections. The food was excellent. My lamb shanks were tender, and had a very tasty sauce. The scallops were also very tasty and the sauce it was in was very good.   As we were dining, mum noticed that the banquette was dusty. We could see this because the sun was just at the right angle. This was a major issue at the prices we were paying for this meal, and really is a ding that this restaurant could have easily avoided (by dusting the banquettes daily??).   Positives:  Great food, good service, nice atmosphere and decor.  Negatives: Price, dusty banquette.   Grades  Overall:  B-   (This would be a "B+" however, the dusty banquette merits                        a grade reduction)  Food:     B    - It was great food, but the prices were a little steep.                        The menu was also fairly limited.   Drinks:   A-    - Good selection of wine here mostly French / Italian,                         and pricing is good. Beware though, no cheap wine here.  Service  A-     - Our servers were social, and very nice. Formal table                           service akin to France. Plus points to our server for                          not recommending just the most expensive things on                           the menu.

I really loved my server Ashley and the lit Eiffel Tower in the center of the restaurant.   Now for the bad part. We ordered the spinach/frisee salad, duck confit with white bean cassoulet and steak with "frites"  Two drinks were ordered: a bloody mary and a french martini recommended by Ashley.  Both drinks were well prepared and strong.  The spinach/frisee salad was fresh with bacon dressing, a poached egg and lardons.  It was fresh but nothing to write home about.  The duck leg confit was ABYSMAL.  While my husband  was eating  I saw his unenthused expression, so decided to take a taste of it.  THE DUCK LEG HE WAS SERVED HAD TO HAVE BEEN SITTING AROUND THEIR REFRIGATOR FOR A WHILE PRIOR TO BEING SERVED.  I cannot believe that Zinc Bistro would serve such an unappetizing, unflavorful , dry "meat".   When we got home, I asked my husband why he didn't tell the waitress how bad his food was and his answer was that he didn't want to spoil my birthday dinner.  I would have been kicking and screaming before I would eat anything so vile.  My steak and frites were NOTHING LIKE I AM USED TO IN PARIS!!!   The steak was cooked medium rare,  au poivre but the meat had no flavor whatsoever.  It also had an excessive amount of peppercorns.  A person who sat across from us returned his steak because of this.  I have eaten steak au poivre many times both in the US and abroad.  This is definitely an excessive use of  peppercorns. None of the restaurants I have experienced do it this way.  Doesn't mean that Zinc Bistro can't be unique.  But, it must be unique and edible.  The frites  were a total disappointment.  They could NOT HAVE BEEN FROM FRESH POTATOES---NO WAY, NO HOW . No WAY, NO HOW... HOW MANY TIMES CAN I SAY THIS?  In Parisian bistros the frites or fries are to die for---simply sprinkled with salt and they are amazing.  Zinc Bistro's fries had this or that sprinkled on them but this did not improve the lack of flavor from the potato.  OMG,  what can I say about a restaurant that  charges more than a Parisian  bistro but none of its flavor.   One saving grace was that they gave me a complementary mini-chocolate souflee as I was celebrating my birthday.   Zinc Bistro management.... check that duck confit dish.... go into the kitchen right now and taste it.   Get ready to spit it out.   I am feeling super-uber guilty that my husband ate that vile dish and kept quiet about it so he wouldn't spoil my birthday dinner.   Zinc Bistro,  how long can this quality of food continue before Scottsdale patrons realize that they are not eating anything like what is served in a Parisian Bistro.   I have to give Zinc Bistro one star--earned by Ashley and the complementary chocolate souffle.

Over the years, I've eaten at Zinc Bistro quite a few times.  It isn't somewhere I think to go often, but when I do, I really remember having great meals, so I'm not sure why I don't pop in more often.  Anyway, we decided on Zinc for Sunday brunch on Father's Day, and I was glad we did.  We all ordered drinks and I had a bellini.  It was quite tasty and refreshing.  For lunch, I ordered a salad and the rest of the party all opted for the steak frites.  Everyone really enjoyed the steak and frites, especially the sauce it came with.  The salad I had was their take on a caesar, and I really enjoyed it, especially the added touch of fresh dill.  The service and overall experience was awesome.  I would highly recommend this spot for a "fancy" special lunch/brunch and even dinner.  The patio seating outside is also nice, but not for the summer months!

This is my go to spot when I have family or friends in town and want to take them somewhere classy for a great price. And that serves amazing French food!  I love sitting in the garden off the back of the restaurant. So peaceful, it almost feels like you are no longer in a busy city.  The food, from the french onion soup to the Jidori chicken. God the Jidori chicken! I have dreams about that dish. So amazing!  The crab stuffed crepes are to die for. I could just go on and on!  Service is okay, probably the only reason I do not give it a five star. Everything about this place is on point!

Service:  For a lunch hour it was the place to be!  However, we split to items on the menu and it took for EVER!  We ordered a salad to split and a hamburger.  We sat for a good 15 minutes between finishing our salad and the delivery of our hamburger.  And it was a bit frustrating when then table that sat down next to us was brought their meal way before ours came out! Quality of Food: My grandmother and I got the house salad to split and a hamburger.  The salad was brought out on separate plates; a bit smaller than I had thought...and definitely glad that I didn't get it just for lunch.  The hamburger was small!  Not cooked to our liking.  While they did take it back and "re-cook" the burger it seemed dry when it was brought out again.   Service: it was OK.  When we brought our problem to the manager's attention she blamed the kitchen and how their ordering system worked.  I really didn't buy it as I had worked in restaurants before.  To her credit, she did take care of the meal. Cleanliness: The restaurant seemed clean; it was the restrooms that were in need of attention!

Love Zinc!  I get my Parisian fix here.  The French cuisine is top of the line, and the waiters are on their game.  The ambiance evokes a true bistro in Paris, complete with the bar in the front of the house.  The soups, salads, and entrees are all wonderfully prepared and presented.  I have had only the best at Zinc Bistro!

DON'T EAT HERE ! This place was so dark! I couldn't read the menu! I asked both the waiter and the manager if we could turn up the lights and they just said no. They brought me a flashlight to read the menu!  Stupid and just plain silliness. The guy and his girlfriend had to get out their phones to read the menu.   We walked out.  **NOTICE** the trending details for this place has gone down dramatically over the past 4 months.  What does that say!!  Service sucks.  ** NOTICE** One of the reviews mentions that there was a COCKROACH just not once but TWICE in someone's salad. Health department needs to come out to this place.

Fantastic restaurant!  Went here on a recommendation and couldn't have been more pleased.  I had the salmon and it was just wonderfully prepared and delicious.    The service very polite and knowledgeable.  I'll be back next time I'm in town.

I have a love affair with a sandwich. The basil chicken sandwich is the best thing that has ever entered my mouth. My taste buds do the jive when eating it. The fries with truffle oil are delicious. The Parisian atmosphere is authentic. The wine is plentiful. The "secret garden" patio is gorgeous. Go treat yourself, you derserve it!

This place is as close to sitting on the street in a Paris bistro as you can get. Instead of Parisian snobs you get Scottsdale snobs, and instead of historic buildings you get teenage girls with victoria's secret shopping bags giggling as they walk past, but at any rate, you get the drift.   I was expecting the service to be more pretentious than it wound up being; the host, server, and bus boy were all really straight forward and made us feel quite welcome.   I only got to try the Zinc Burger which I must say is one of the best burgers I've ever had. Zinc Bistro proves that a burger is defined by the quality of the beef and not by all the extra sauces and spices. I think I remember trying the French Onion soup the first time I came here a few years ago and it was great as well, but it is excessively expensive in my opinion ($10) for a bowl.   Overall I think this is a great place to go especially if you have some time to enjoy the patio and sip a cocktail.

Awesome spot with impeccable service. Went in on a Wednesday during lunch.  Had the Crab Salad, Mussels and Pomme Frites, Truffle Parmesan Fries and finished with the soufflé.  Everything was brilliant.  Really recommend a patio spot especially during March / April.
I have been going here for years and I love the place, great pates, mussels, and oysters.  Nice wines and wonderful service, when I am in town this is the place for me.

Dropped in late after a disappointing stop at another restaurant and we were pleasantly welcomed by Jesse the bartender and although it was late and the kitchen was closed he managed to get us a cheese and meat board .  He created a drink based on our tastes- nailed it and had a genuineness that is refreshing.  We were fortunate to have walked by and discovered this gem.  Can't wait to comeback.

The BEST omelet I've ever tasted.  Zinc Bistro's Gruyere omelet is not to be missed! Normally I order the steak or the onion soup, but I decided to try the omelet for a change of pace. It was so good ... I can't wait until I go back so I can order it again. It's THAT delicious!!!  For dessert, as always, I must order a chocolate soufflé. This time with chocolate mint sauce.  Zinc makes the best soufflés on the planet. Treat yourself!
Lovely!!! Great little French spot! i enjoyed all the appetizers and sat outside. great service. the

Been here many times and food is always excellent. Prices have skyrocketed on some menu items. Example... Flat iron steak. Their web menu shows $28 but we were charged $34. That's a lot for flat iron steak, I don't care how good it is.  And what's with the Mexican music in a French Bistro? I enjoy Mexican music but not in a French Bistro. Service was excellent until our serve disappeared for a while (must have been break time). I have always given Zinc 5 stars but this experience was far from worthy of 5 stars. The only reason I gave 3 is the food was very good. Don't miss the chocolate soufflé.

Food and atmospheres is great. Unfortunately we had terrible service. So bad that we will never come back no matter how great the food is. Maria D was our server and had the worst attitude and hardly saw her. Everything took a while to get including water. It was all blamed on the kitchen even when she forget to put in our order.

Really Really Good!  Mussels were outstanding which are steamed in a really good sauce.  Crab Crepe was really good. Like a crab and cream cheese filling.  Oysters were fresh.  I had 3 kinds.  Blue Points, East coast. Fanny's and I forgot the 3rd.  I don't think an Onion Soup can get much better than theirs.  Perfect flavor in my opinion.  The house salad with the goat cheese crouton was good.  Dessert was really good.  Hard to choose between all the goodness.  We settled on the chocolate suffle (takes 30 min to cook) and the Binette with 3 dipping sauces.  Sooo good.  We sat in the garden.  Such a nice atmosphere.  We will be back! Only thing I would say is they need to update their prices online because half the items we got were a few bucks more than what they have stated online.  Kinda pricey but for how good it was It didn't bother me..  You get what you pay for.  Made reservations online which worked out great.
Words can't give justice to the filet with foie gras.  It's pure bliss.  Creme Brulee was delicious as well!

This was one of our regular spots. But unfortunately during our last visit it was an absolute cluster. It took about 15 minutes for anybody to acknowledge us once we were seated, another five minutes to get water, approximately 30 minutes for entrées to came out. When my duck confit sandwich finally did come out, it was an absolute joke. The waiter agreed that the quantity of duck was absurdly small. Sent it back. Would have been a one star review but the manager was smart enough to comp our small check. Not sure if we will ever be back or bring friends here again.
I and 3 friends had dinner here on Saturday night. Service was wonderful and food was amazing! Love this place, keep up the good work. We will be back:)

Food mediocre at best. Really... Scallops and coleslaw? Tasteless scallops to boot. Salmon over cooked. Mushroom ravioli in tomato soup.....not what I expected. Doubt the tomato sauce was homemade.   And don't even look at the website......hasn't been updated in over a year! Oh, and they ran out of the featured dinner for two at 6:30 on a Saturday night.....::poor experience. Will never go back. Big money with poor presentation.......too bad......

Zinc Bistro is my go-to restaurant to fulfill my after dinner / late night dessert cravings. Zinc Bistro makes from scratch an amazing Chocolate Souffle that comes with your choice of chocolate, mint or Gran Marnier sauce. If you decide to dine in make sure you place your order before dinner as it takes about 30 minutes to prepare. For dessert goers who have dined else ware, Zinc Bistro's souffle preparation time is perfect to make a little room while enjoying a glass of wine or coffee.

Had a nice Cab last night at Zinc. Love the atmosphere, great service and great food. Flat iron steak salad...awesome. Really great signature drinks as well. The seafood sampler platter...wonderful as well as their cheese boards. Truffle fries...wow...they have won awards with their fries!! Also, a great place to lunch....they have an atrium room with brick and fountains that is open to the outdoors from above...quaint...you feel like you are in a small french bistro. I have been frequenting this restaurant for the last 4 years...regularly for lunch and dinner...not once have I had poor service or a meal I had to send back to the kitchen. :)

If you are in the mood for a quality French Bistro experience, look no further than zinc Bistro. This is my go-to place for french onion soup, a good sandwich or salad, and a craft cocktail. The patio is beautiful on a nice weather day, and the bar offers a unique French style experience.

If I lived closer to Zinc I would be a regular. Instead it is the spot me and my husband always end up going to for date night, anniversary's, and birthday's. Great atmostphere, amazing food. Sometimes it's a little bit of long drawn out meal, but I think thats part of the fun and it's worth the wait!

We've eaten here several times over the years. I'm such a creature of habit that I've usually only had the flat iron steak or the filet, and of course, the french fries.  But for our most recent visit I tried the Halibut. I had no idea what I was missing out on! Even the cauliflower was outstanding.  At the end of our meal I told our waitress that "every single bite of everything I ate tonight was outstanding." And I meant it.  From the Organic Salad to the chocolate soufflé, outstanding.

I stopped in from the cold (yes a cold winter's night) for a beer and bowl of their famous French union soup. The soup is hardy and with the bread is a meal. The ambiance is upscale nyc bistro complete with tin ceiling, rich woods, and stainless steel bar top. It's pricy. A cup of soup was $12 and one beer was $10.

Arrived on a Wednesday evening at 5:30.  Just a few parties were there when I arrived.  Service was excellent.  Sat on the patio and enjoyed the quiet view.  Most parties chose to sit outside.  Muzack inside was a bit loud and seemed empty and lonely inside.  Food was very good.  Delicious spinach salad with bacon dressing and lots of pieces of bacon along with a perfectly soft poached egg.  Followed this with delicious, super fresh mussels  in white wine, cream, and herbs which were perfectly cooked.  The mussels were an appetizer size serving, but in combination with the other things I ordered, I had plenty to eat.  Finished off with the chocolate souffle with Grand Manier chocolate sauce and french press coffee.  The coffee was disappointingly weak (water to coffee grounds ratio was wrong).  The chocolate souffle and sauce needed to be a bit sweeter and richer and did not live up to the other reviews that I read.  Next time I would skip the souffle and coffee and try something different. Cost of dinner was $38 including tax, before tip. It was a very enjoyable evening and I would definitely go back. I agree with others who have said the prices are a little high.  I kept the price of my meal down by ordering 2 appetizers rather than ordering an appetizer and an entree. This saved $10-$15.  I also did not order anything to drink.  If you plan on ordering a 3 course meal with a glass of wine or a cocktail, you should plan on spending about $70-$80/person.

service, atmosphere, and food are all perfect.  this is one of my very favorite restaurants in Scottsdale.  as a resident of LA, i don't often get a chance to dine at Zinc, but every time i'm visiting family in AZ, i make it a point to make my routine visit to Zinc.  make sure to try their duck confit sandwich, truffle parmesan fries, and chocolate souffle -- you won't be disappointed!

I would probably only go to this place during restaurant week. Their regular menu is overpriced, and their wine selection by the glass is poor. They do have some good wine by the bottle, but if you're not interested in dropping $$$$ you may be disappointed. The patio is cute and the food really is authentically french, but it's mainly the wine selection that's disappointing.  Overall the place is good, but not 5 star good.
I like the foo-foo French cuisine every once in awhile, but Zinc is fabulous b/c its every day French and not overly priced for the quality and creativity.   Bon Appetite!

Reminiscing about my dinner at Zinc Bistro makes me feel all melty, like slipping into a hot bath... Very decadent. I had the onion soup - it's remarkable how when onion soup is not loaded with salt it actually tastes oniony! Followed it up with the duck confit. I preferred the sliced duck rather than the crispy duck, but both were delicious, and the risotta was out of this world. Do I want the souffle? Yes please! We had the chocolate with Grand Marnier sauce, and the kitchen pre-divided it before baking so we each had our own perfect portion.  Two small complaints: 1. Despite having a reservation, our party was seated in the crappiest table in the house - the booth next to the kitchen door. We were promptly moved as soon as we requested it, but the worst table in the house should never be given to a (extremely polite) party with reservations. Save it for your rude, self-important, entitled Real Housewives of Maricopa County walk-ins. 2. The butter for the bread was rock hard. That's one of my biggest restaurant pet peeves, and it irritates me even more when it happens at a restaurant of this calibre. I need full and equal butter distribution on my bread. One giant hard chunk in the middle, or a wad of bread shredded by trying to spread icy butter, is a total buzzkill. It's the little things, guys.
We went here for lunch one day and it was great.  Food was delicious...wine was good.  i suggest going here for nice lunch or dinner.  The service was also very good!!

I was visiting Scottsdale for work and my coworkers chose since as our dinner option. The ambiance on the courtyard is beautiful, calm, and quiet. The food was delicious, our table ordered the muscles and pork belly apps which were a huge hit. Then I ordered the short ribs sand the sauce and a simple salad for my starter, the portions are relatively small, it is a French restaurant. The meat was cooked perfectly, I  was happy with my decision. The salad was literally a bed of lettuce with I asked for no crouton that was supposed to come on it. I expected them to have some variety of raw veggies when I asked for the simplest salad with the most veggies. When it came out it was literally a ramekin of dressing.. A small plate of lettuce..$10 for that! I would order that again. My coworker had the French onion soup and the other the spinach salad which they were happy with. The there's ordered the scallop, rock shrimp entree with chorizo risotto. They were very happy with their orders but once again surprised by the small serving size of 3 scallops and 3 spoons of risotto. We get so a custom to our very overly large servings of food that small or "normal" servings that are quality become a rare site. Overall, good food that was not a nice ambiance. Don't come here expecting large portions, or to get your fix of veggies and salad. The dishes are tasty and the staff are attentive.

This is a favorite spot for us in Scottsdale, both for an intimate dinner or a family meal (teens to my elderly mom.) I wouldn't bring small children here.  Service is excellent and the menu is dependably French. Love the cheese board and charcuterie: great way to start a meal with a crowd.

I was on my way to catch a Southwest flight out of Term 4 gate C-18 and noticed this place. I ordered a shaved grilled chicken with "gem lettece". It was iceberg lettuce with chicken, some shaved cheese for $16.50 + $3 for a quarter of an avacado.  It was iceberg lettuce which costs $2 a head. While the salad was delicious, I found it a bit overpriced for a salad with iceberg lettuce. I also had a cup of coffee for $3.29 which was weak and lacked flavor. Lunch was $29 including tip. No booze was ordered.

Good place with a great selection of champagne and decent menu.    Typical Snottsdale crowd (materialistic, ordinary and boorish BUT wearing a Rolex and driving a German car because it matters to them).    Fun place which reminds me of Paris dans le desert (except for ze peeple).

Well, i cant really tell you how the food is because i didnt try anything. I walked in they sat me down in the patio like i asked got me a glass of water. I drank my water looked at the menu and the busboy brought me more water 15 mins later no one asked me if i wanted to order. No one even asked if i was ok! Waiters kept passing by i dont know maybe it was the way i was dressed in a baseball cap and under armour wear. Anyhow i just got up and left without saying anything. LoL

I thoroughly enjoyed my Scottish salmon and oysters; however, I felt really bad for my hubby. He had the ravioli, and it was not cooked long enough. My hubby was so hungry he ate it, which I felt bad. The ravioli was chewy. We came for our 5th wedding anniversary, and expected decent food. I'm appreciative for my food, but wish the money spent was well worth all the food.

Best brunch I've had in years! The ambience matched the relaxing atmosphere mixed with amazing customer service is what made it a 5 star experience for me. I will most definitely be returning and will let my friends and family know of my awesome experience here. I highly recommend the French press coffee and house made biscotti. Did I mention excellent service? My coffee was always warm and water glass always full. Need I say more?

Great vibe and attentive staff.  Two must haves... the macaroni & cheese and the short ribs.  I am not much of a meat eater but you could feed me the short ribs every day (with a side of mac of course).  The wine list is extensive and updated often and the staff knows which wines to suggest.

Charming and Delicious, French Onion Soup has great depth. Mussels, excellent. I would  have given 5 stars if the French Fries served with mussels had been like their side of French Fries vs a shredded pile of potatoes.

zinc bistro holds a special place in my heart.  i love patio seating as long as wafts of cigarette smoke isnt blown into my face as im enjoying my meal. the service can be a bit spotty here, but pretending youre on a parisian sidewalk makes up for it. ok maybe youre stuck in the scorching hot arizona desert, but zinc will bring you there for a couple hours. even for a drink or two or three, zinc is the perfect place to round up your pals and throw back some greygoose martinis in hot 115 degree weather.  choice dishes: duck confit sandwich side order of mac & cheese croque madame flatiron steak illy coffee  bonjour scottsdale-ites.

Best Mac & Cheese and Fries...WOW!  Nice quaint corner restaurant in the heart of Kierland!  Makes you feel like you're in Europe somewhere!  Staff is awesome, very friendly!!!  I believe they also part own the Mission, which I've been dying to try!!!???!!!

I hosted a party of four at this terrific restaurant.  We enjoyed their garden room that really is the best in indoor/outdoor dining. Menu is still creative but also includes classic bistro fare like mussels and French onion soup. Service is top notch. The sole reason for four instead of five stars is that it is quite expensive. It is the perfect 'special occasion' restaurant.

Sometimes you just need a night out with good company. My first time at Zinc bistro was incredible. The partisan feel, the staff and the food were all remarkable. From the moment we walked in, I was in complete bliss. I tried the duck confit, and it was delightful. Cooked perfectly, poised on top of a bed of beans, sauces and deliciousness. I ended our stay with a cappacino which came with sugar cubes on the side as well as a biscotti. Give yourself a night out and come here.

It's very rare that we are able to go out to have a nice dinner with our busy schedule/strict diets so we decided to go to Zinc Bistro for the occasion.  We were seated in a strange corner booth that awkwardly faces another group of people.. Just the beginning of a terrible dining experience. The service was absolutely dreadful. Our server was very brief; she didn't bother to go over the menu with us nor did she even spend more than 30 seconds interacting with us. She brought us very warm, watered down "hot brewed coffee" that was some of the worst coffee I've ever had.  When I asked her what she would recommend for an entree, she gave me a stony look and responded very rudely. After she finished taking our order, they brought us cold/chewy bread that was hard to eat. When our entrees finally arrived, our server stopped by to ask if everything was okay, she turned to walk away while I was in the middle of answering.   Although the service was unpleasant, our food was quite the opposite: appealing! I ordered the Duck Confit and would go back to order it again. So many different flavors that balanced very well together. Tender/ juicy duck leg, delicious bean cassoulet and cherry tomatoes to cut through all of the heaviness of the dish. The foie gras sausage had no liver taste to it at all which I loved!   After dinner we were pretty stuffed but wanted to try dessert. Having a hard time deciding, we thought our server was coming by to help out but she came over to say "are you going to order the soufflé because it takes 20 minutes to bake and we close in 20 mins".  We decided against ordering more food and asked for the check.   Our server didn't come by to pick up our payment for a while. We weren't sure why she was being so friendly to the table a few feet away and being so cold to us. We are pleasant people and can be very generous when it comes to ordering and tipping. We would never act rude to people working in the service industry so it was just awful to have this experience.   Although we had a rollercoaster of experiences here, we would definitely come back to give them another try, the food is very good!  The hostess was friendly and the server assistants did a good job refilling waters and clearing our finished dishes. Cheers!

Arrogant, a-hole bartender with a condescending attitude.  Not one compelling menu item.  Intelligencia sort of atmosphere, that was not appealing to me.  Very comfortable patio chairs...great view for watching people...but if you are craving dinner, walk 100 steps to another Kierland establishment. I will never darken their door again. Very French in their attitude....if you know what I mean.

I love this place. It is "American" French food establishment. Translation, non pretentious french dining at a reasonable price. I have tried most everything on the menu over the years and have yet to be disappointed. The crab omelette and the steak frite are my two favorites. Their onion soup is wonderful and pretty darn big.

My boyfriend chose Zinc Bistro for a Friday date night spot for two reasons. 1: The quaint Kierland location and 2: The mussels appetizer. He was right about both.   The mussels were divine... Dipping the bread into the tangy juice followed by a glass of Merlot was just heavenly. If our meal ended there I would be back in a heartbeat.   I did not care for the dish I ordered. At first glance the crusted black sea bass sounded perfect but I soon remembered the reason why I avoid the daily specials. Shame on me. The bass was tasty but the mushrooms and endives did not pair well with the fish. Separately, these three would be a delight. But something was off and the flavors just did not blend.   The boyfriend was happy with his filet topped with a generous portion of foie gras. Two bites of his rich meal with the side of mac and cheese made up for my lackluster entree. If we try Zinc again I'll be sure to ask for recommendations.

What a nice, quiet, cozy spot to unwind after a long day. This place has so much character! I went late in the evening. They were out of their favored teas but the plain green tea was delicious! The bartender was very helpful in choosing alternatives. Outdoor and indoor seating available. I will go back and try some of their dishes.

We like this restaurant and return frequently when we are in Scottsdale as we did today. I had mussels and my wife had pate along with a side order of matchstick potatoes. We also shared a bottle of rose from Provence. Everything tasted great which was no surprise. Service was great, as usual.  During the meal I knocked over a glass of wine spilling it and breaking the glass. It was my fault. Not only was the manager very kind, she brought me a replacement for my spilled glass: unnecessary but a very nice gesture. There is something special about this place!

Great French Bistro! We were told by locals to make this a definite must do for lunch on a recent trip to Scottsdale. Service with a smile is the mantra at this small crowded bistro. Close quarters make the atmosphere even more authentic. The décor and the menu are very much like several spots we have dined at in Paris. We thoroughly enjoyed our lunch of mussels, salad and wonderful French rolls. Reasonable prices and friendly service made the hour spent at Zinc Bistro even better!  Can't wait to return for dinner on our next trip to Scottsdale.

We walked in with a baby in arms and was greeted with less than a happy face from the hostess   We asked for a table away from other diners. (The baby was  well behaved )  we sat out the front away from any other diner and promised to move the stroller if another patron needed the table next to us.    The food was very average  the curry pumpernickel sandwich was okay nothing to rave about. The mac and cheese was pretty good   The chocolate soufflé was good. Hint : order this when you are placing your food order and ask for whipped cream at that time also.

I think this is my favorite restaurant in Arizona.  Been 3 times in the last year, not a bad thing to say about this place, not even close to a bad thing to say.  Food is unbelievable with a ton of options.  I love the a la carte seafood.  Great beer choices too - I don't drink wine but the wife raves about what she gets every time.  Quiet and great mood.  Servers are among the best I've ever had. It's not cheap but totally worth it.

We went to Zinc to celebrate my son's new job.  After having made reservations, I was a bit non-plussed at being seated one table away from the kitchen.  Aren't these the tables for late comers?  As is my usual practice on a first visit to any establishment, I just suck it up and wait to get on Yelp.   The servers were very good and friendly - a bit touchy - lots of shoulder taps - which was okay, I guess.   I really couldn't decide whether this bothered me or not.  For about ten minutes, we had the sun directly in our faces.  The servers suggested me move a little to be out of the sun and assured us that it would only be a few more minutes until the sun would be out of our eyes.  I guess they can't afford window coverings.  This is when I noticed the extremely dusty banquette - I even stood up and ran my finger through a healthy accumulation!  Good grief - I am sitting there, eating 32 bucks worth of scallops and staring at dust.  Geez.  Food was good.  It was expensive.  I felt okay about the prices, though I was not wowed to the point that I would make this a regular place.  If you look at Marie-Eve's review, they came in late, without reservations and were seated in the PATIO!!! Maybe we should have done that.  The wine list is pretty good, but no bargains there.  I might give it  a go for lunch some day, since my son's new office will be near there.    Anyway, to make myself all better after this not so great experience, we went to Delux Burger for dessert and nightcaps, otherwise, I would have pouted all night.

I came for lunch with a group of 10 ladies over the weekend and absolutely LOVED IT! I had been years ago and was quickly reminded that my visits here need to be more regular.   It's a fab spot for a lunch meeting or girl's outing. And at night I'm sure it's so romantic for a date night! They have 2 lovely patios and the food is amazing. I ordered their shaved chicken salad and oh my heavens, it's the best. We also split their truffle Parmesan fries because, you can't say no to those!   There were so many hearty salads on the menu that it was hard to choose what to order. I will absolutely be back with my hubby soon! My only complaint was that our waitress was not the friendliest but we didn't let her rain on our parade! We had a great time. Their French {literally} bread is also amazing!   See you again soon, Zinc!

Just brought some friends from out of town (NY) and their only request was to sit outside to enjoy the weather before going back to the snow. Told the 1st host we had 7 people but forgot to mention "outside" but she had left to check out the table already so we followed up with the 2nd host (Asian girl) and asked if we could be sat outside and she said "We'll see what we can do". Ok. 1st host comes back and our table is ready and 2nd host (Asian girl) who we've been with the whole time walks us back to the table inside which prompts me to ask "So I take it this means we can't get a table outside?" To which she says "No". She didn't even try! We were with her the entire time!   I look out on the patio to find that there was indeed plenty of seating so I just asked the busser who was about to set down our drinks if we could sit outside and he took the initiative to go find if we could. Sure enough, it was no problem and 1st host made it happen (who was never informed of it in the first place).   So long story short, thank you to the busser and host #1 but Zinc Bistro, please tell Asian host lady that ignoring and blatantly lying about patron requests is no way to treat frequent diners.   All that said, after many times here, this was the first time we've ever experienced anything close to poor service. The rest of the meal with our friends was great. Don't let lazy Asian host lady ruin your rep.  I'm keeping a high rating because the food is great and the service is TYPICALLY good. It wouldn't be fair to let one lazy person ruin the overall experience.

Okay, so I love to eat at great spots with an amazing atmosphere.  But Zinc exceeded my expectations with all that and a reasonable price. I am definitely going back. The wines are great, the food (try the Salmon ) was beautifully prepared and the service was incredible.  Sherry j

Great atmospere.....excellent food.......and awesome desserts. I always get the duck confit it is to die for......their french fries are great, they come with 2 different dipping sauces........you can sit indoors, out on the back lush patio or out front on the sidewalk...very French atmoshere......

My parents and I had a last minute change of plans on Christmas Day so we drove around looking for a place to eat dinner.  Luckily, we came across Zinc and they had an available table for us.  With the very small exception of my oyster appetizer coming extremely late, the service was perfect.  My mom enjoyed her swordfish, while my father and I both ordered the tenderloin topped with fois gras.  My favorite part of the dinner was the wine, which was very reasonably priced.  I selected a 2005 Chateau Gloria which drank beautifully at its youthful age.  The crowd can get a bit loud, but then again, it's a bistro and this was Christmas.  I can't wait to go back, drink more wine and enjoy more wonderful food.
Over priced generic salad with a very little crab for $20 WTF very disappointed will never go back lunch for 2 was $60 and we left hungry

love, love, love their basiled brie chicken sandwich and fries. the souffle is amazing. the mac and cheese is amazing. never been disappointed. only sad thing, not good for take out, the food gets soggy.

Good food, good steak, good fries. Really good French cuisine with an upscale flair. I loved the service and it felt like we were in Paris for the evening. Overall, I wouldn't say it was family friendly, but I think it would make a great date night.

So disappointed with the costumer service today. This party cut in front of us, and even after I had mentioned it to the hostess, she still proceeded to help them first. Where's the courtesy nowadays both professionally and personally, especially on Christmas? The excuse I was given by the manager?  "It's stressful right now because the reservation system is down."  Needless to say we took our business elsewhere. No accountability here. #lumpofcoal

The only reason I come to this place is the little patio, I love sitting on the patio while grabbing a bite with a friend.  I think the menu needs updating.  It feels a little dated.  Last time I had the chicken salad sandwich, because nothing else seemed appetizing.  My friend had the same.  Kierland is one of my favorite malls and this spot can offer some good people watching.

Best onion soup in PHOENIX. Actually it makes me think that I am back in Paris. Year in and year out this restaurant maintains it's quality and high level of service. A sidewalk table is quiet and somewhat romantic.

Ignore that 5 star rating I just gave Zinc Bistro.  You should avoid this place at all costs. That way I will never again have to wait for a table at my favorite French restaurant.   While your at it - stay away from the DMV too. Thanks :)

Went back in August (for Birthday dinner).  After Mission I had huge expectations, and unfortunately not one was met.  Almost empty restaurant but service was terrible.  On multiple occasions had to seek out an employee for a basic request (silverware and water kind of thing).  Food was ok, but considering my expectations that ended up being disappointing.  Everyone has an off night so I'm hoping this was the case here, but I doubt I'll return to find out.

My father and I went to lunch on halloween here and ordered two hamburgers and on order of garlic fries. Starting off with the good, the fries were very good. Crispy on the outsides, soft on the inside, very good flavor. I will say for $12 the should be good. As for the burger, I would highly suggest to not order any burger here. Both of our burgers came out and I felt like it was the Wendy's commercial all over again...where's the beef? The beef patty was at least 1/3 smaller than the bun and that's being generous. I've eaten here in the past and it was wonderful. However, the burgers lacked taste and were not filling at all. In addition, when we asked for extra lemons and ketchup, the wait staff seemed to forget these. Maybe they were too excited about being dressed up for Halloween. Overall, great place for dinner, but I will never be back for lunch.

We went for Restaurant Week. Both the service and the food were fantastic. The lamb was so good I requested a momment of silence to enjoy it. Every dish was an explosion of flavors. The desserts were perfect comfort food. I came with friends but the outdoor garden would make for the perfect date atmosphere.

Went to Zinc last night for dinner. The decor and ambiance turned out better than I thought. I was expecting trendy sit-down restaurant place, but it ended up being more vintage and it had a pretty nice Bar area which was really popular on Saturday night. It was a bit noisy, but it didn't interfere with our dinner. I'd say it was about 50/50 split between people having full on dinner, and people just having some drinks with cheese and appetizers.  Now onto the food ... We ordered the onion soup, which must have been one of the best I've had. Not salty, the broth wasn't heavy, onions were cooked perfectly. I'd say this one is "a must" at this place. Main entries: 1) Seared Ahi was excellent - seared to perfection; 2) Pork Tenderloin was great as well. We just got their House White wine to go with the food. Generous pour of the wine was nice and lasted through the meal.  Overall: I'd come back here again.

I'll give two stars because my husband enjoyed his lunch.  I used to love Zinc and have eaten there many times for lunch and dinner.  After today I won't be going back. I had to send my lunch back.....how can they ruin a Gruyere omelet? It was barely warm and the cheese was hard.  The side salad was microscopic and the potatoes were insulting. It was a bad lunch and someone was asleep in the kitchen. Not acceptable.  The service was just OK. Not acceptable either.

My partner and I have dined in France so we really like what Zinc Bistro is doing for French cuisine here in Scottsdale Arizona.  The decor from floor to ceiling is spot on.  I love the inner patio.  When the weather is nice I like to see "the ladies who lunch" in their hats/bonnets.    On my last visit to Zinc I ordered a sandwich.  We were there for lunch so it was a sandwich that day.  Curry chicken salad to be exact.  Just the right amount of spice and curry.  I had a side of truffle Parmesan fries.  They were so good.  I couldn't stop eating them.  To drink, I ordered a Duvel.  Its a Belgian beer/ale.  It has a high alcohol percentage.  Boy does it ever.  One was enough.  Zinc Bistro is our French lunchtime getaway.

came here one night alone.  the hostess sat me down and kept staring at me as if there was a problem eating alone! i found that a little rude.  my waiter, however, was nice.  I only got the french onion soup and chocolate souffle for dessert since i heard good things about their soup.  it came out in this cute little cauldron, piping hot, cheese all gooey, and several crispy chucks of cheeses were tucked near the edges.  it was good french onion soup, although i have not tasted enough different french onion soup to judge it as one of the best.    the chocolate souffle took a while to make but it was quite delicious.  my server brought it out and poured this warm choc sauce infused with some sort of liquor.  the etoh didnt evaporate so there was still a strong taste to me, which i dont prefer.  the souffle itself was soft and fluffy which was good.

If I had to get lost in a corner spot, this is it. I have a thing for the French and Zinc Bistro makes my top 3 places here in Scottsdale. Whether it's lounging on the terrace with my girlfriends or determining the compatibility of flirtations, you'll find me happily sipping on wine and soaking up sunshine. Otherwise, plant yourself in the darken room or back terrace for mysterious adventure.  I don't think their menu items have escaped my insatiable appetite. My favorites are the beignets, pork belly, and truffle fries for starters. Trust me, you will perk up instantly with these. I never pass up the mussels because they know how to seduce me with the leeks, rosemary and garlic fries. I will almost loose my ladylike composure and pick up the hot pot to drink up the sauce. It's that frickin fantastic. My fave dinner item is the duck breast. Fatty goodness with black truffle. How does one go wrong with that?   Your wallet might cringe but then I guess that depends on how you value self investment. I'm all about the return and this place is a sure thing for me. Service is always attentive and friendly with top notch quality food. Bartenders are fun and lively so you are never short of conversation or company. Seriously, you instantly become a Parisian dining here.

Ok I will be short but what I have to say is not so sweet. I am astounded that this place is still in business.  We went this last Saturday night and were treated horribly. After an hour of waiting for our food and not having been acknowledged by our waitress. My husband & I got up to leave. (The people next to us had fininshed thier meal and they had been seated 20 minutes after us.) We asked to speak to the Mgr. He did not come, only sent the bill for our food ( that we never had recieved) and said that he would have it wrapped up for us to go. When we stated that we wereonly going to pay for what we had been served the Mgr (then suddenly appeared &)   said that he was going to call the sherrif. I think everyone has expereinced bad service but this place literally takes the cake.

Over the seven years since we've been coming to Zinc Bistro, we have never had anything less than a Five Star experience  Whether it's lunch, dinner, drinks, or just a quiet Valentine's Day night out, it's always been great.  Beef, seafood or chicken, it doesn't matter because everything is delicious.   Zinc is modeled after a Paris bistro. The prices are inline and appropriate, with such a wonderful fine dinning experience.  So sit back and enjoy, because you are in for a treat.  We made reservations for Valentines's Day for about five-thirty.  The bar area was packed and all the tables along the window were full.  There was a small line outside, but we were seated immediately.    Our server Frankie introduced himself and we knew the night would be special.  He was from North Bergen, NJ and to say he was character, would be an understatement.  He was warm and funny, occasionally touching shoulders while making a point.  He seemed to know instinctively what we wanted. We would come back just for him.  Amazing!   We started off with a glass of New Zealand Pinot and a glass of French...  and finished sharing a petite Chocolate Grand Marnier Soufflé and some decaf expresso. Wonderful meal, wonderful Valentine's Day night out.   Expect to pay $55 to $85 each, depending on how many courses you try or bottles/ glasses you drink.   Enjoy!

This replica of a Parisian bistro serves up bistro classics such as the flatiron steak, cassoulet with duck confit, and delicious pommes frites. It's a great place to sit outside at the patio cafe.  Excellent wine list with many reasonably priced French wines.

I absolutely love Zinc Bistro! We went for my husband's birthday and had a wonderful evening. Absolutely no wait on a Friday night at 7 pm, which was a nice surprise, and even got seats in their beautiful hidden little courtyard. (Make sure you ask if there are tables available out there if you want a quieter, romantic evening as it can get rather loud inside when the place fills up)      For dinner my husband had the french onion soup to start,  which as always was the best you will find anywhere around, and the flat iron steak with zinc potatoes (their version of au gratin potatoes but with no cheese) He loved the steak, a perfect medium, and the potatoes were creamy and perfectly cooked. We do miss the cheese though!    I started with the tuna tartar, which is served with rye toast points and a cornichon paste, it was so good my husband, who refuses to eat raw fish, even tried a bite.... and liked it! Then I had the short ribs, which were melt in your mouth tender, as short ribs should be. My only issues was the amount of vegetables with the ribs... I think I literally had three slices each of carrots and celery... But they were delicious as well :)    We were then surprised with a little birthday treat for my husband which I will not ruin for anyone else who decides to celebrate their birthday here. I will just say that it was a perfect ending to a perfect meal.    Overall, I will have to say that Zinc Bistro is honestly one of my favorite restaurants in the Valley and I have never been disappointed in anything I have had there. Not to leave out that the service is always amazing and the staff is fun and friendly. Definitely try this place out!

Great French bistro with elegant dining room, romantic enclosed patio, plus street side tables.  Wonderful ambiance and service.  Long nickle topped bar with large wine list.  Excellent French themed food with lots of creative dishes.  Oysters are terrific as is the French onion soup.  Definitely will return.

I like the ambiance and their fries, seriously they are that good!  My young daughter likes the tuna at lunch too and they have several other dishes that are great!  It was busy and they did accommodate a last minute reservation for dinner which was nice.    The salmon salad which is really not a salad, was just ok.  My husband and daughter liked the marbled rye bread that came with it.   Husband's steak was undercooked and had to send back, which we hate to do but can't eat it raw either.  Our waiter was ok and who said he only knows Italian not French ( I didn't ask just heard him tell this to others..) was busy running around but seemed perturbed when taking our order, that did it for me the entire night.   We wanted the chocolate soufflé but he didn't offer it as a dessert ahead of time but he did for the tables around us and we didn't get since it takes 20 minutes..  I think it was just an off day for them not sure just sharing what we went through.  It was the first time for my husband to come here and I was sad that he didn't like it other than the fries..

We are dining here right now (7pm on Saturday August 23) .  Apps - my wife had the pate which was more of a terrine than a pate.  TAsted good but was dry and just ok.  I had the foi gras mousse which was also just ok and a bit watery.  The duck special included a duck sausage that had a southwestern flavor.  A bit odd in  a French bistro, the duck breast was cooked correctly but was a small portion.  I had the scallop which had 3 medium sized scallops that had a bit of an ammonia flavor usually indicating that it was not fresh.  And, at $36, that made each scallop $12. All in all a bit over priced and over rated.  This is a Scottsdale attempt at French bistro that comes up short.

Now this place has a great menu! Came for lunch and was very happy with the food. Sat at the bar and had a nice beer and sandwich. Food was seasoned well, prepared with care and tasted dang good. It's not somewhere most people will want to go for lunch every day. It'll probably cost you around 20 bucks and that's a bit much for most. I do think that their food is worth the money. Fries were great and so was my salad.   Bartender was nice and the place was full in the middle of the day with a pleasant afternoon crowd. It's a fun place.

I hate when a restaurant screws up an order, one of our guest asked for her grouper without sauce. She was kind but emphatic to the server...no sauce. Of course her meal came out covered in sauce. Now this causes a dilemma for everyone. Whether to eat their meal while it's hot or wait for the guest dish to be remade. No matter what happens it ruined the evening for everyone.    The food was outstanding and I would have given a five star review except for inexcusable mishap. They didn't even offer to comp her meal.  This was a major faux pas for the restaurant in how it was handled.  When you spend this kind of money for an entree you expect better service.  There are numerous places to dine in Scottsdale...won't be back.

Just got done with lunch and service was horrible. Julienne my server was very inattentive. She came around to check on things hardly at all. When I finished she took my credit card and ran it and then slapped the check down on my table with a "here you go" remark and off she went. If Julienne worked for me she would have been FIRED!

Love this bistro because of the food.  It seems quite authentic, too - sort of like being in France except the service is faster than it would be in France.    My favorite item is the duck confit sandwich - it is not always on the menu.  You can also get a great glass of wine here.  I've eaten at the bar and that's a fun experience - you can talk to other customers and the bartender.  It's a friendly place with nice customers.  When I want to treat myself, I come here.

My wife and I went here for dinner last night.  It was a Monday night at 8pm and the place was not too busy at all.  There were only 3 or 4 other parties in the place so we were seated quickly.  The decor of the place is actually pretty neat.  I got the "France" vibe even though I've never been there before.  It also goes without saying that I'm not super experienced in the ways of French cuisine.  While almost everything on the menu looks decent and pretty unique to my American eyes, but my wife and I decided to try something simple.  We split the flat iron steak.  It was very good and perfect to share.  We also shared the truffle and Parmesan fries and they were AWESOME.  I also had the iceberg salad to start and it was unique and delicious.  I would get it again.  I know, I know - I didn't go all out and order some hardcore French cuisine.  Next time I come I promise I will be more adventurous.  The service was friendly but a bit off.  Our waiter asked if my wife wanted more wine which she declined because she had 1/2 a glass left.  When her glass was finished, they took it away and didn't ask if she wanted another to accompany her entree (which she would have liked).  Also, a half hour went by after our salads until our entree came and there was no sign of our waiter who seemed to abandon us.  The place was almost dead by now so it was odd.  All-in-all it is an ok place and I would return.  I'm not sure if I'm going to rush back but I'm not crossing it off my list just yet.

Tried to make a reservation for three on New Years Eve & to inquire about the menu for the evening. She told me to "call back later because I can't assist you with that right now." Haha really?! What a customer service disappointment in one of my favorite spots in North Scottsdale. Guess my wife and I will have to find ourselves a new favorite. R.I.P. Zinc.

Ok, I went here a while ago so i dont remember exactly what i got. But it was along the line of steak. It was delicious. Very crowded atmostphere and noisy. Service, eh it was ok. But food was amazing! Check it out!

Ambiance was nice, but otherwise not super impressed. We came on a Friday night at around 7pm and were seated immediately. Patio and courtyard were full.  Plenty of open tables on the inside. Service was extremely slow. It took about 20 minutes to order and then another 40 minutes before our food arrived.  My steak came out rare instead of medium, so I sent it back and waited some more... The steak was smothered in peppercorn which I thought was a bit much. It was a quality piece of meat, but seemed to lack flavor (other than the peppercorn). I will probably give them another shot, but not eager to go back anytime soon.

The food at Zinc Bistro is absolutely fantastic! I went yesterday for the first time and had the curry chicken sandwich and bites of my family members meals. Everything was great.   The reason I'm giving Zinc Bistro three stars instead of five is  because the service was horrendous. After looking around, it seemed that it just might have been our waitress as the people around us didn't seem to be getting great service either.   Everything was fine until our food arrived. When it did, I asked for another glass of water and my sister asked for some french fries. Neither came until the end of our meal. We would have asked again, but our waitress didn't come see if we needed anything and it seemed nearly impossible to flag her down. When the fries and water finally came, the waitress put the rim of the pitcher right onto the middle of the glass where my mouth had been! She continued to do this for the rest of my family! This pitcher serves the entire restaurant, it was definitely unsanitary.   However, I again stress that it just seemed to be our particular waitress.

This place never gets old...I love everything about it.  You feel like you are walking into a genuine French bistro...amazing food, great location in Kierland Commons and great staff.  Our bartender this past visit was amazing...great personality and he hooked us with drinks.

Eaten here a few times. Just finished lunch and had a great salad & sandwich. The salad I had was the spinach with poached egg, it was awesome. My taste is for savory, "umami", this was perfect with the egg bacon and light dressing. The chicken sandwich was good with basil and brie. Then the creme brulee with tahitian vanilla was great. Just a nice quaint place to sit outside and have a good lunch. One problem I have with Zinc Bistro is that they have Stella on tap, great right? But for $7! That's one for $7. Come on, maybe $4. I just bought 12 for $10 at Total Wine.

ZINC is one of the most consistant places to eat in the valley. Zinc is the only place for a late lunch = bottle of wine and no time commitments! The entire menu is delicious and the decor makes you feel like your in a French bistro (especially once the wine kicks in). Weekend evenings are too crowded and busy. Go non-peak and savor the moments.

We came in for a drink and stayed due to the armosphire.. a great place!  Ended up with Mussel apps and was pleasantly surprised with the cilantro accent.  Drinks..service .. food A +  Make this a stop.

Zinc Bistro is a little piece of France right here in the desert. I am constantly missing my life I once had in Paris; it was such a growing period for me in so many ways. Culturally , learning diversity , to survive in a country not my own! THE FOOD! THE WINE!! But, I can't afford to travel back every month as I would like to! The one thing I've found in the valley, where I am always impressed with the food and drink scene is the lack of French eateries. There aren't that many! Recently on a Sunday afternoon , my husband and I popped into Zinc Bistro for a glass of something on the patio. It SO reminded me of cute bistros in Paris and really throughout Europe, where the people 'take' a relaxing drink or tea or cafe in the afternoon and bistros like this are everywhere! I always loved this way of life while living in Paris, cafe or a wine in the afternoon whilst sitting in a cute cafe people watching or getting in touch with a friend. This is that place! It may be in the rush of Keirland Commons.. but, use your imagination and you almost COULD be in Europe! We sat on this patio and enjoyed perusing the ample wine list that has an amazing assortment of French wines , from all over great regions of France. There are a few French and European beers too. Great French champagnes by the glass and by the bottle ... yes. Please. There are a few special wines from California too. We shared the Moules Marinière et Frites. It's under the hot starters , but we shared this and we were full! Especially when they kept replacing the lovely housemade crusty bread that is delectable for dipping into the garlicky broth!! There are many amazing starters and an amazing charcuterie and fromage starter on the menu too. If you only wanted to do what we did , which is enjoy the beauty of the fall weather and pretend for a little that we were back in France! This was a perfect afternoon for disconnecting from the world and technology, and just enjoying each other over wine , and not feeling rushed. NO one rushed us ! We even dined next to a famous retired NFL player , ( hint, he was a winner on DWTS!) .. so it must be good.. he seemed to know the wine list well! I can't wait to come back and try the Chateaubriand dinner pour deux.. $130 for 4 courses is not bad !! This was a great French find in the valley and voilà ... j'adore Zinc!!

I agree with A.B:  Overly pretentious clientele Food does not deserve the high prices Snotty staff  I think the only redeeming factor for this place is the patio.  If you want French-inspired Bistro food head over to Coup des Tartes. If you want REAL French food, go to Vincent's. If you want to be insulted, overpay for your food, and regret your evening, go to Zinc.

I was watching food network and they featured Zinc for their French Onion Soup.  I happened to be shopping at Kierland Commons with my mom and grandma and putting two and two together I stumbled upon Zinc.      Zinc is an adorable little French bistro great for lunch or an intimate dinner. We ate in their courtyard and they had flowers, candles and all sorts of unique decorative pieces to observe.     The food is as good as the bistro is cute! I had a amazing salad and we shared the souffle for dessert!  Next time I am going to try the soup!

we were in n scottsdale yesterday and decided to have lunch we ended up at the zinc  bar in kierland commons not our normal m o but were always up for an adventure zinc was not our first choice but it was a good choice we ended up having thecheese platter a choice of 3 or 5 cheeses out of 9/10 to pick from served w/bread  olives in a warm olive oil....    yum... a modest portion of sliced meat some walnuts/apple/grapes a nice noche for 14/24 dollars a bottle of wine and great service at the bar which is where we sat

I went there wanting a snack around 5 pm. Their happy hour lasts until 6. I had an amazing seared Foie Gras appetizer. It went perfect with a Moscow Mule! If you're staying in the North Scottsdale area and don't want to trek down to Old Town, this outdoor mall is a great alternative, and you have to hit up Zinc!

I have came to a realization why they decided to call this place Zinc Bistro, or at least I think. But boy oh boy, this restaurant is delicious. Dined for lunch with the Varzi salumi salad and butter leaf champagne with a glass of a refreshing red sangria. Salad was extremely tasty and the sangria was light and perfect for a sunny day. I contemplated giving 4 stars since our server was not the friendliest nor did the hostess allow us to sit where we wanted. But the food was so delectable, I have decided to wave that off (which never happens)! Great atmosphere and outdoor patio in the Kierland area.  Every time new dishes were brought out to the tables, my mouth watered, yum. I can't wait to try Zinc for dinner one night, it will be worth it! Enjoy!

Really enjoyed this place. First night in town I walked around the area which in itself is worth seeing and found the Zinc Bistro. Being on eastern time I was ready to eat at 4:00 so stopped in for a meal. Limited lunch menu but still some great choices. I opted for the burger and it was very flavorful. Frank was my waiter and he was terrific. A group of us, 6 in total, went back two nights later, we had a lovely table outside all to ourselves. Perfect for conversation and the weather was delightful, it's been a while since this Michigander sat outside to eat. Again, another great waiter and everyone was thrilled with their meals. I had the halibut and it was prepared perfectly. One ordered a salad before his entree and it was huge, really a meal in itself, so advise it be shared unless you have a big appetite. Would definitely go back.

This is one of my favorite restaurants and I always go when I'm in Scottsdale! I would give this 5 stars but am reluctantly giving it 4 stars because it seems the service has gotten a little spotty. It's not that the service is bad but you really notice when it's "ON". They've spoiled me on past visits so I may have unrealistic expectations. Seems unfair doesn't it? The food is consistently good. The crab and mushroom crepes are always a hit and the chocolate souffle is a treat! For entrees, I always order something new and have never been disappointed. Their specials are always good. It's great fun to sit outside and people watch while you're eating.

Waiter was very friendly upfront. After we placed the order we never saw our waiter again. This was at 5:30 pm on a Wednesday. The place wasn't even busy. After I received my order it was not what i ordered. I asked where our waiter was and they said he was busy. I have been to Zinc about 10 times and now we will never go back. The waiter never came to the table. The manager came to say sorry for the multiple mistakes but I asked where the asparagus we ordered was ... Multiple and multiple mistakes throughout the night. This is not the service you would expect when your sending over $200.00 for 2 people. I will never return.

I cannot believe the reviews on Yelp.  Here is what you really get.   A very small portion that hardly is enough for a child. Everything is ala cart.  Salad, is very expensive, Side dishes  very expensive, and entries are ridiculous. A small piece of chicken is 30 dollars,  a steak very small is 48 dollars. Service is OK, taste is good, but I would never go there again.
Really good burger and French onion soup. Nice cheese's too.  Good Parisian atmosphere and menu. All imported wines by the glass. Saddle up to the bar and hang out & people watch.

Great food and classy feel.  Walked in not knowing it would be a $200 meal for 2 but rolled with it.  Stands outs were the charcuterie and cheeses.  Good wine by the glass selection and a scallop dish that was seriously one of the best I have had in a very long time.  Good eats at elevated prices but with great quality.  Not bad for a Monday, but even better for a romantic Friday.

Good food most of the time. I have not had a bad meal there. It does not wow my socks of or anything but I would go back for sure. The owner is a bit of an idiot at times, drinking and hitting on girls in the bar is pretty inappropriate but I guess he can do what he wants.

I stopped in here for a light dinner on a very hot day and ordered the cheese and meat platter with a glass of wine.  Everything was great!  There were so many cheese choices that I didn't know what to pick but the server was nice enough to help me choose.

Zinc Bistro is fantastic eatery serving French Cuisine. I always go here for their amazing onion soup. It's a definite must have if you are into soups. The melted Gruyere cheese on top makes this soup one of the best I've ever had. The ambience is classic French with a cute and quaint court yard tucked inside. Eating in the courtyard makes for a very romantic experience. I highly recommend this place.

I have never been disappointed at Zinc. Wow. A treat for a special occasion or everyday high quality experience. Something special for everyone's taste. Today was no different. I highly recommend this restaurant indoor or outdoor dining.

another phenomenal dinner at Zinc Bistro. The Flat Iron steak special seemed like an excellent choice along with sharing some of the Fruit de Mer--specifically, Shrimp and oysters. Everything we ordered was excellent!  Great meal and very good service!

This is more of a place for desperate housewives to be seen than a place to get authentic French food. That being said, the food on the menu is decent for what it is, and if you can ignore the caddy, dramatic women talking way too loudly as they scarf down their crab salads, it's not a half bad dining experience.
A little pricey, but we had a great New Year's meal. I'd definitely go again.

Food is amazing - authentic French food! You can choose to dine inside, dine outside for some Kierland people watching, or they have a private patio lit with lights and candles for a more romantic setting.

Although it is registered under the French restaurant category, the food is more American French. We ordered mussels for appetizer, which is cooked with white wine, herbs, and lemon. For entree, we ordered duck with risotto and halibut with corn bread. The duck is tendered and the halibut is fresh. The food is decent, but it's not special.   The restaurant has a lot of sitting areas (outside along the street side walk, garden seating, and indoor seating). The staffs are friendly and prompt.

We tried Zinc Bistro for the Restaurant Week Menu.  We both started with the Vichyssoise (Classic cold potato leek soup) The Zinc Bistro's version of this soup was kicked up a BUNCH with these tasty Salmon Croquettes topped with PASTRAMI CURED SALMON topped with radish and lemon pickled onion. The creamy soup was laced with what I think was leek oil and what I think was Esplette and was great alone but with the addition of the adorned Croquettes it became amazing and really was one of the best things I had anywhere this year. This soup was OUTSTANDING and should be on the summer menu as it was PERFECTION for a summer meal.    I sure didn't mind ordering Scottish Salmon for dinner as it was meticulously well crafted with many little details. They took the time to roast a baby fennel till it turned caramelized. They Pickled a pretty red Endive and turned it into something interesting and pretty. The nicely crusted and seasoned Salmon sorted of popped a little with the addition of sweet and tangy Kumquats. This all at on a pillow of creamy rich puree studded with Beluga Lentils that pop in your mouth like caviar.   The Confit Lamb Shank was just as wonderful being melt in your mouth perfect and was a gastronomic journey of Moroccan Style Seasonings with interesting crafted vegetables.  The Hazelnut Toffee Chocolate Torte was good and rich! The creamy Ice cream seemed to lighten it up a bit and the Burnt Orange Honey Carmel complimented it very well.  The Show Stopper Dessert was the Canelles De Bordeaux with Vanilla Brandied Cherries, Espresso & Valhrona Mousse. The little Cake Towers were delicious and had a texture like no other. They were firm and almost caramelized and the inside sort of melted in your mouth and had a rich pastry cream taste and soaked up the light very chocolate Mousse and Cherries. It was maybe the best dessert I had this year!  Service was friendly and efficient.   This was a Great Dinner!

My husband and I went for dinner last night and really enjoyed our evening.  We started with the Ahi Steak Tartare.  I would come back for that dish alone!  I normally order the tartare where ever I go, but this has been my favorite!  As my entree I had the scallops and risotto and my husband the filet.  A little pricey, but good.  We ate indoor, but will probably try the garden next time. My husband ordered the french press coffee...just fyi...the open small white cup with the small spoon is not sugar, but salt! I ruined his coffee.  LOL
We have been eating here for years.  Love the outdoor patio and the garden.
Service here sucks. I love the food still.  But the service is so bad, I never want to come back. Honestly.  Sorry Zinc, ya'll need to get new servers or some shit.  AWFUL service. AWFUL management.
Bummed, the only thing that was truly amazing was the foi
The food itself is ok. The dessert is to die for and the atmosphere is awesome. A favorite place to have.dessert and wine at the end of the night

I had a party of approximately 15 people out in the garden area. Honestly probably a nightmare table to take care of because my friends tend to be high maintenance but our server handled everything well! The menu was difficult to read so I recommend looking at images on Yelp first!! In the end everything was delicious and the ambience was amazing.. my only complaint is that one of their staff members was harassing us. When we sat down he was going on saying how he just turned 18 and honestly stayed way up in our personal space throughout the experience making some of my friends uncomfortable

This place is great! Went for a lunch date with my fiancé. Between the two of us we had the French onion soup, Dungeness crab crepe, Jidori Chicken, hangar steak, soufflé, and the creme brûlée. Everything was amazing. My fiancé was not fond of the soup, he says it had a sweetish aftertaste. I enjoyed it though! The crepe was straight from heaven. And the creme brûlée? No words. It was all so amazing. We had a good lunch experience. Didn't feel rushed and the food didn't take long to make it to the table. Our server even made sure to let us know that if we wanted soufflé, to order it early as it takes a while to make.   The only reason for 4 stars is because the hostess at the time didn't seem to really know what she was doing. She may have been new though, so I won't be too harsh.   This was only our first visit so I will update when we go again - because we will!

We were very excited to spend Christmas Eve here...we've walked from our home and had cocktails before and just love the atmosphere, so it was an easy pick for this special meal.  While the decor and atmosphere set this apart from many restaurants once again, the meal my fiancee got and the illness after made this a less than great experience and we won't be risking a return visit.  Most of the meal was fine, although when she received her entree of short ribs it was cold.  She sent it back and received what seemed to be a slightly warmer entree, but we both deemed it warm enough to eat since I already had my steak in front of me and the issue set the flow of our meal back.  The server was nice enough to remove the entree from the bill, but my fiancee spent the next two days (including Christmas Day) in bed dealing with food poisoning.  We had the exact same food and beverages, except for the short ribs...and she was unable to celebrate Christmas or enjoy our Christmas meal.  There is no contact email on the Zinc Bistro site or we would reach out directly.  Hopefully this helps prevent such a situation in the future for other folks, and I do hope they reach out to us directly.

Given the positive yelp reviews we were anticipating a night of fine French dining; however, that was not the case.  While the food was good the service was not. It being the Saturday night before Easter it's understandable the restaurant is busy and service can be slow. Once our party had all arrived we were promptly seated and our drinks were quickly brought. Unfortunately, it went downhill from there. We were seated in a booth table in the bar. The bar had about 6-8 other patrons. The music was loud and being seated near a speaker it was difficult for our 88 year old father to hear. We asked for it to be turned down a little. Our waitress informed us it couldn't because it was in the bar area. We asked again and the manager said because our table was the only one that could accommodate a party of six we would need to stay in the bar area and the music couldn't be turned down. One look around the restaurant and we saw multiple tables that could have been pushed together to accommodate us.  Once the bar emptied out a bit someone lowered the music only to have it turned up again a minute later. It was really weird.  It took a long time to get our food, over a half hour. My husband and daughter ordered the $130 meal for two. They had a choice of sauces for the chateubriand and ordered the red wine sauce and it came with béarnaise. A little thing but for the price that is something that should be checked by the server before the meal goes out of the kitchen. My cassoulet wasn't hot and missing the foi gras sausage.  At least once I told the manager it was promptly brought out.  While the manager checked in with us our server was nowhere to be seen. In the end they did comp us with two desserts which was a nice gesture. Nonetheless, it wasn't the evening we were hoping for - a disappointment.

I've been here a bunch of times and everything on the menu is super good.  The service has always been great.  I recently tried the crab salad with some hesitation but was pleasantly surprised.   This place is much better for lunch than it is for dinner.  There's a funny sort of crowd that comes here for dinner, plus I think the lunch menu is better than the dinner menu.

I took my daughter this past week-end for lunch.  While being seated, I mentioned to the hostess that we were celebrating a birthday.   Once seated,  we ordered the french onion soup to start.
